{
    "id": 577613703,
    "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/saltstack/salt/issues/56328",
    "body": "### Description of Issue\r\nthere is mismatch keyword argument between `cassandra_cql` and `cassandra_cql_return`\r\n\r\nthe function [cql_query_with_prepare](https://github.com/saltstack/salt/blob/master/salt/modules/cassandra_cql.py#L365) is defined like below\r\n\r\n```python\r\ndef cql_query_with_prepare(query, statement_name, statement_arguments, callback_errors=None, contact_points=None, port=None, cql_user=None, cql_pass=None, **kwargs):\r\n\r\n    # Backward-compatibility with Python 3.7: \"async\" is a reserved word\r\n    asynchronous = kwargs.get('async', False)\r\n```\r\n\r\nthe first line of the function gets `async` param from `**kwargs`. \r\n\r\nhowever the returner, `cassandra_cql_return` calls this function with argument that is named `asynchronous`.\r\n\r\nSee the below code line.\r\n\r\nhttps://github.com/saltstack/salt/blob/master/salt/returners/cassandra_cql_return.py#L205\r\n\r\nhttps://github.com/saltstack/salt/blob/master/salt/returners/cassandra_cql_return.py#L226\r\n\r\nhttps://github.com/saltstack/salt/blob/master/salt/returners/cassandra_cql_return.py#L268\r\n\r\nhttps://github.com/saltstack/salt/blob/master/salt/returners/cassandra_cql_return.py#L298\r\n\r\nthese functions call `cassandra_cql.cql_query_with_prepare` with `asynchronous=True`, but actually `cql_query_with_prepare` not work asynchronous\r\n\r\nmaybe missing in this commit https://github.com/saltstack/salt/commit/377fbbc7b760bad1fd267747bf463e7cc8f3c1ae\r\n\r\n### Setup\r\nNone\r\n\r\n### Steps to Reproduce Issue\r\njust see code.\r\n\r\n### Versions Report\r\nmaster branch",

extracted_body:
{
    "body": [
        "### Description of Issue
there is mismatch keyword argument between `cassandra_cql` and `cassandra_cql_return`

the function [cql_query_with_prepare](https://github.com/saltstack/salt/blob/master/salt/modules/cassandra_cql.py#L365) is defined like below

```python
def cql_query_with_prepare(query, statement_name, statement_arguments, callback_errors=None, contact_points=None, port=None, cql_user=None, cql_pass=None, **kwargs):

    # Backward-compatibility with Python 3.7: "async" is a reserved word
    asynchronous = kwargs.get('async', False)
```

the first line of the function gets `async` param from `**kwargs`. 

however the returner, `cassandra_cql_return` calls this function with argument that is named `asynchronous`.

See the below code line.

https://github.com/saltstack/salt/blob/master/salt/returners/cassandra_cql_return.py#L205

https://github.com/saltstack/salt/blob/master/salt/returners/cassandra_cql_return.py#L226

https://github.com/saltstack/salt/blob/master/salt/returners/cassandra_cql_return.py#L268

https://github.com/saltstack/salt/blob/master/salt/returners/cassandra_cql_return.py#L298

these functions call `cassandra_cql.cql_query_with_prepare` with `asynchronous=True`, but actually `cql_query_with_prepare` not work asynchronous

maybe missing in this commit https://github.com/saltstack/salt/commit/377fbbc7b760bad1fd267747bf463e7cc8f3c1ae

### Setup
None

### Steps to Reproduce Issue
just see code.

### Versions Report
master branch"
    ],
    "title": [
        "mismatch function argument between cassandra_cql and cassandra_cql_return"
    ],
    "labels": [
        {
            "name": "Bug",
            "description": "broken, incorrect, or confusing behavior"
        },
        {
            "name": "P4",

        },

            "name": "ZRelease-Sodium",
            "description": "retired label"
        },
        {
            "name": "severity-low",
            "description": "4th level, cosemtic problems, work around exists"
        }
    ],
    "description": []
}

    "id": 26544829,
    "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/saltstack/salt/issues/10030",
    "body": "By default, /var/log/salt/minion lists all changes made by states and is readable by everyone. This causes leaks of sensitive data.\n\nFor instace, if Salt is used to set password hashes or the contents of files only visible to root, all this content will end up in the log.\n\nThe logs should only be readable by root.\n",

    "id": 25942129,
    "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/saltstack/salt/issues/9857",
    "body": "Howdy,\n\nIt looks like the data structure return for publish.publish has changed from 0.16.x to RC1.\n### SLS\n\n```\n{%- set self_env = grains.env -%}\n{%- set self_dc = grains.datacenter -%}\n{%- set redis_compound_string = 'G@node_type:redis and G@env:' +  self_env + ' and G@datacenter:' + self_dc -%}\n[beaver]\npid: /run/beaver.pid\nsincedb_path: /home/beaver/since.db\nformat: json\n\ntransport: redis\nredis_url: redis://{{ salt['publish.publish']( redis_compound_string , 'network.ip_addrs', 'eth0', 'compound').values() }}:6379/2\nredis_namespace: logstash\n\n[/var/log/unattended-upgrades/unattended-upgrades.log]\nsincedb_write_interval: 3\ntype: unattended-upgrades\n\n{% if accumulator|default(False) %}\n  {%- for line in accumulator['beaverd-logs-accumulated'] -%}\n    {{ line }}\n  {%- endfor -%}\n{% endif %}\n```\n### RC1 Return\n\n```\nredis_url: redis://[['11.11.11.11']]:6379/2\n```\n### 0.16.x Return\n\n```\nredis_url: redis://11.11.11.11:6379/2\n```\n\nIt looks like to make RC1 work correctly, you need to add `.pop().pop()` onto the `.values()`.\n\nJason Swindle\n",
    "user": {
        "id": 1776251,
        "url": "https://api.github.com/users/JasonSwindle",
        "type": "User",
        "login": "JasonSwindle",
        "node_id": "MDQ6VXNlcjE3NzYyNTE=",
        "html_url": "https://github.com/JasonSwindle",

{
    "id": 499317697,
    "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/saltstack/salt/issues/54790",
    "body": "### Description of Issue\r\n\r\n[This merged PR](https://github.com/saltstack/salt/pull/41210) clashes with the downloadonly parameter we already had for the [yum](https://github.com/Da-Juan/salt/blob/ed8dde469a34b00532b0e0eafa57d1de6fb00aa4/salt/modules/yumpkg.py#L1113) and [zypper](https://github.com/Da-Juan/salt/blob/ed8dde469a34b00532b0e0eafa57d1de6fb00aa4/salt/modules/zypper.py#L898) module. The parameter should be `downloadonly` and not `download_only`.\r\n\r\n### Versions Report\r\nSalt >= 2017.7.0.\r\n",
    "user": {
        "id": 34246,
        "url": "https://api.github.com/users/brejoc",
        "type": "User",
